Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: christelle28
Reviews.Content: the hotel is well located , in a quiet street overlooking a nice canal . It is a very short distance away from Piazza San Marco . The staff is really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: cityfan097
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Location perfect (once found!), just a couple of minutes from St. Mark's square with plenty of shops (take an empty suitcase girls!) and a good variety of restaurants very close by. The hotel is the red building on the left of the photo. As requested we got the desired room, twin and as low as possible. Walls could have done with a quick coat of emulsion. Bathroom, although somewhat dated was well equipped with plenty of towels and hot water. Beds and pillows were comfortable.There is no lift and plenty of stairs! Staff very welcoming and friendly. Simple, more than adequate buffet breakfast but no hot food. Have stayed in 4 star hotels in Italy with less comfort than this affordable 2 star. Only real negative point were mosquitos in April, take plenty of protection!

Reviews.Title: “Delighted we found this little gem”
Reviews.Author: Loubox
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our trip to Venice. It is a little hard to find but the hotel do give a good printable map and directions on their website. The location is fantastic, set on a quiet enough canal across from Mozarts house and 5 min walk to St Mark's Square and about an 8 min walk to Rialto. Everything, including the staff, was lovely from the second we got there. We stayed in a suite with a canal view, and other friends of ours stayed in a superior room with canal view and I can honestly say for the overall extra price we paid we were delighted! Our room was top floor and we were told we had "the best room in the house" which I completely agree with! Big bed, large wall mounted flat screen TV, plenty of storage in the wardrobe and a chest of drawers, a safe, a table with 4 chairs and a separate seating area with fold out sofa bed and a lovely balcony looking right down on the canal where you could watch the gondolas going up and down all day. The bathroom was small and had a shower but no bath (which was no problem for us) and there was toiletries provided. The breakfast buffet was good, no hot food but a good selection of pastries, meats, yoghurt, cheese and breads and your tea/coffee was brought to you. This is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in, the price we paid for the best room in the house was amazing, we stayed for 3 nights and we absolutely loved it. Compared to everything else we saw this place was a good bit cheaper and turned out better than I could have wished for. Yes, it is typically venetian meaning steps and character but if you dont want it stay in a boring chain! I think some of the negative reviews on here are unjustified, people who have issues with stairs and continental breakfast should read up the hotel information before they decide to book.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the other hotels, the best is HERE!”
Reviews.Author: meryjune
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience, all I can say is positive. The hotel is located about 300 mt from Piazza San Marco, in the heart of Venice. Check in was quick, my room was on the third floor and there's a good deal of stairs to climb so be young and fit. The room was perfect, it was recently renowed, with one single bed, enough lighting fixtures, flat screen tv, a little balcony, private bathroom with shower, toilet, hair blower etc...and......air conditioned! It wasn't obviously on at the time I stayed but it would have been if it was summer, it's quite a bonus in Venice. Breakfast was a small but satisfying buffet of salty (salami, bologna, cheese, soft cheese, bread) and sweet (pastries, cakes, cereals, jam, butter, honey, chocolate cream, yogurt...) items. Accompanied by a hot drink. The staff is cool, very kind, I really appreciated all of them. Also the hotel is open 24 hours per day, no curfew. So a recently renewed single room with new furniture, private bathroom, air conditioned, immaculate cleaning, a good breakfast, close to San Marco costed me 45 euros one night, 55 euros the other. It's the best ever, no other place in Venice would give me a decent breakfast for that price, most will just offer a sad, carb loaded, sugar loaded, totally unhealthy pastry and that's all. This place was a great choice, I'll be back next time.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: lunakit
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much for helping to make our trip so enjoyable, we have just returned from Portugal from a wonderful weekend in Venice. The welcome we received after a long and tiring journey, immediately put us at ease. The location was ideal for us, halfway between Rialto and San Marco, made sight seeing and getting lost easy, set on a quiet canal in a peaceful location. The rooms were immaculate, warm, and the hotel staff friendly, helpful and knowledgable. Sheets and towels changed daily. We left the hotel at 6 A.M. this morning, and the night staff went out of their way to prepare us a little breakfast to send us on our way. By Venice standards, excellent value, and I would not hesitate to recommend to anyone this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK”
Reviews.Author: mherring59
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location and at the time we went it had recently been renovated. The room we had was nice and spacious, however lacking any information that is essential for example: fire escape route, breakfast info, how to use the telephone or internet. There was absolutely no information anywhere. Three flights of steps with no help with your luggage. Reception was lacking hospitality. I would look elsewhere for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: Janet H
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located about 5 minutes walk from San Marco square (and the vaporetta stop), which makes it a very nice point to start exploring Venice. We stayed here for 3 nights, our room had a very nice bedroom with a big bed (nice firm mattress, great pillows), living room with a sofa (opens up into a double-sized bed) and a big bathroom (shower, no bath) with new, fluffy towels. We had three people in our party (grandmother, mother and a 7-year old child). Service is excellent - we arrived at 1 am, and the beds were all made up for us (sofa was also made into a bed), and the room was air conditioned. Breakfast was more than ample, selection of smoked meats and cheeses was varied and everything was fresh. A very nice touch - at breakfast they serve freshly brewed cappuccino in addition to the regular coffee. The hotel is located right on the smaller canal, and the building is old (hence, high stairs throughout and old, small closets in the room) but the building is kept in excellent condition. Everyone in my family is asthmatic and allergic to pretty much everything, and we were very cautious going to Venice in July, thinking of mold and insects, etc, but the hotel is all smoke-free, and again, very very clean. They allowed to keep my daughter's soy milk in the fridge at the reception for the duration of our trip, and they also kept our bags at the reception after check-out for half a day at no charge. The property owner and the reception team are super nice and help with directions around Venice. So for your trip in Venice, I strongly recommend this hotel. My only advice is to download a map into your mobile phone with GPS before coming to Venice, as finding the hotel for the first time, at 1 am, with a sleepy child was a challenge (however, there were some people, gondola drivers and police around at that time to ask for directions).

Reviews.Title: “My visit to Venice, Hotel Mercurio”
Reviews.Author: latinopablo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modest but the service is good. The best think of this hotel is that is located 5 minutes far away to plaza San Marcos and the vaporeto station, so is very easy to move arround once you get familiar with the area, is a little difficult to find the first time due it doesnt have a big advertisement. The room we stay was single, one bath, tv and clean. The price compared to others hotels is very cheap, so if you dont want to spend much money is OK, the price we pay on Dec was $60 Eur per night. It includes breakfast, is not as big as we are use on America, but it has ham, frut, yogurt, coffe, juce, chease, and sweet bread. One advice buy the vaporeto ticket for two or three days depending of your stayment, but you can use it to go anywhere, Burano, Murano, arround the "Canal Grande" its alittle bit expensive but it worth, we pay $25 Eur for 36 hours per person. If you want to have a good lunch take te boat to LIDO is a nice place with better prices, Plaza San Marcos is good but you can imagine the prices. If you want to but Murano stufs, I mean if you really want to spend some money you can go, but if not, you will just spend time walking watching the stores and cute hadcrafts of glass, I think there are more places to go if you have short time in Venice. If my comment is good for you pleas rate it as usefull. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gary W
Reviews.Content: Mercurio is about 10 mins from the main stops at St Marks Sq for the boats coming from the airport and we found it easy to find with the Fenice Opera house as a nearby landmark and some good directions on the hotel's website.. It is off the beaten track a little but perfect location for seeing Venice. Our Superior room overlooked the canel with gondolas meandering their way all day long. It was very good size with a balcony and two separate sleeping areas with a Queen Size bed and a sofa bed. Excellent clean bathroom and the room was tidied and beds made etc every morning. Breakfast was OK continental fare. Overall cannot really fault this hotel at the price we paid and can highly recommend it for the budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Venice hotel”
Reviews.Author: schmunkie
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mercurio is in a very convenient location. If you hire a water taxi, they can take you within 1/2 block. It is a 2 star for sure, but clean and comfortable. The price was reasonable for the location and we would stay there again. The staff is very helpful and the breakfast was a good European selection with coffee. There are quite a few steps to haul your luggage up, but it just proves that travelling light is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Decent price for its popular location!”
Reviews.Author: hikerchick10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Santa Croce area last year in a wonderful hotel, but wanted to stay closer to the main attractions in Venice this time. I picked Hotel Mercurio primarily for its location in San Marco and for its reasonable price for a hotel in this highly popular area. We had a little bit of a hard time finding it at first, but once we located it...it was very easy to get to and in a great location (only a few minute walk to Piazza San Marco). To be honest, I thought our room would be a little bit nicer...but it was large enough in size. Our parents had a suite in the newer or maybe renovated part of the hotel and their room was amazing! Our room did have a nice view of the canal and we often heard gondoliers singing as they passed by. I thought the staff was very nice and accommodating in every way. I am really surprised to hear about the bad service that a previous reviewer talked about. They couldn't have been more helpful to us if they tried. Jacomo, Monica and Natali were each extremely helpful in securing our water taxi to leave, helping us find the restaurant we were looking for and other locations as well and even in bringing luggage to my parents' room. I must have been there at the same time as the previous reviewer as that our TV was also out due to the storm. It affected the old part of the hotel, not the newer part. To be honest, I came to Venice to see the sites and get lost in the charm of the city...not to sit in my room and watch TV...so while that was a shame (for the TV not to work)...it didn't affect my stay whatsoever. The included breakfast was ok, but what they lacked in assortment, they made up with pretty good cappuchinos. One negative...there are no elevators. This didn't affect me for my room, but my parents stayed in the newer part of the hotel three flights up. When my father (in his 70's) heard that he would have to take his luggage up three flights of stairs, he almost reconsidered staying there. No worries, Jacomo came to the rescue and carried their luggage up for them!! I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travellers1704
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find there was no lift and as we were travelling for 4 weeks, our luggage was heavy. The price for the stay was quite expensive, the breakfast was poor and there was no customer service. We were given 'the apartment' to stay in which is under the hotel. Each morning we had to go upstairs to have breakfast which was not worth the climb! We purchased expensive wifi which could not be used in the apartment, the noise of the traffic in the canal kept us awake, not to mention the rock hard beds and pillows. The towels we were given when the room was made up were wet, there was very little natural light in the room to dry them! When the reception was contacted regarding the tv in out room which did not work, we were told 'I am alone at the desk, wait for the technician tomorrow'. When asked the next morning, the lady at reception said they had a black out recently so that had effected the tv. Overall the location was good but I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great and cozy little hotel”
Reviews.Author: giome
Reviews.Content: Overall the rooms and bathrooms are very clean. This hotel is great if u are planning to just stay there for a comfortable sleep and within the day u will be out sight seeing. It seemed to be in a very nice and safe location, very close to Piazza St. Marco which is wonderful during the day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: D0nnaK
Reviews.Content: My daughter was staying at this hotel as part of her study abroad program. She became quite ill and I traveled over to Venice to be with her. The staff couldn't have been more compassionate, helpful and accomodating! They went out of their way to provide assistance to us and were hospitable above-and-beyond all expectations. The hotel itself was spotlessly clean and very well maintained. It was conveniently and centrally located. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, and hope to do so very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small room with great servce”
Reviews.Author: AnnS3703
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything we expected. It was located within walking distance of everywhere we wanted to go to in Venice. The room was small, but clean and welcoming. The staff was helpful and kind. Our trip to Venice was enhanced by our stay at this lovely hotel in a 900 year old building. A lovely breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Not alot of good things to say...”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Flyon
Reviews.Content: I wont stay here or recommend this hotel to anymore. Firsly before we could get to reception there were steps to climb - no lift. So for older poeple or people with large luggage not ideal. This is probably standard in venice not sure. Monica at reception was very friendly and recommended things to do. The room was a fine size but it was very out dated and didnt have much natural light. The main problems were that the air con was terrible it barely worked so we didnt sleep very well. Its was beside reception, no 26, but there was very little noise which was good. Bathroom was small but it fine for us. My partner told me after we left that there were ants in the room which freaked me out and not acceptable anywhere. Breakfast was very basic. Price was â‚¬110 per night but not worth this.

Reviews.Title: “Only one bad thing...”
Reviews.Author: taytayalis
Reviews.Content: Overall I really liked this place. The service was nice, room was fine, and location was GREAT! However, our room smelled of urine. My husband and I noticed it a little when we first arrived and went to bed, but the next day when we came back (after they cleaned our room) the smell was fairly strong. My husband tried rinsing the bathroom floor with the shower...in case it was a result of some man missing the target... but it didn't fully go away. I would have thought that after cleaning the room, it would have smelled good...but it was worse. Although you got used to it after a bit, so it didn't ruin our trip or make us change rooms. Overall, I would probably stay here again- but check the smell before unpacking!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Taryn77
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hotel Mercurio were very friendly! We were very very late getting into Venice (2am), but the front desk person stayed open for us and even came to meet us and guide us back to the hotel, which was very kind! The room was right off the lobby and I was worried that it would be noisy, but the door was so thick and heavy that we never heard anything from outside of our room at all! The Wifi is not free - much like everything else in Venice though. Overall it was a nice hotel in a good location, although it was a little pricey. It was clean, quiet, and close to everything. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there twice”
Reviews.Author: MeggygNJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few years ago in a triple room and recently in the canal view suite. The location is great-- you can easily find it by asking anyone where La Fenice theater is. The hotel is down a side street next to it. Both of my stays were great-- helpful staff, good breakfast, painless reservations. I don't think it is worth upgrading to the "canal view." While it sounds romantic it is actually noisy and you can see the same view as soon as you step outside. It is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, well situated. Lovely single room.”
Reviews.Author: kintyre22
Reviews.Content: I had a single room in the new part of the hotel and it was a lovely little room with my own balcony looking out onto a quiet internal courtyard. The bed was firm and comfortable. A nice big bathroom with shower, bidet, toilet and wash basin. It was very quiet. Lights on all the stairs etc came on automatically as you moved about the hotel. A safety deposit box in the room was most useful. The breakfast was typically continental with cereals, pastries or croissants etc depending on that days selection and yoghourts and fresh fruit. The staff were friendly and helpful and always someone about. I was able to leave my luggage until my flight later on the day of checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Fabiolous Venice”
Reviews.Author: lebeed
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night on April 13, 2011. The room that we stayed in had a Canal view. The hotel is across the canal from the house that Mozart lived in. The room had two windows with a fireplace in between. It was an outstanding experience to see boats and gondolas passing underneath the window. The sounds were even more exciting as gondolas pass with singers and musician play in them. The hotel was centrally located in a nice neighborhood in the middle of the town within 7 minutes walk to the St Marco's square.

Reviews.Title: “Great room with balcony, enjoyed gondola traffic, very helpful staff espec. Monica.”
Reviews.Author: beaumeister
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at this Hotel in Oct. 2010 with my wife. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay-good location, large room with balcony over small canal with lots of gondola traffic-good photo ops for my wife. Decent breakfast. Staff, specially Monica very helpful with information on where to go and how to get there. Good quiet sleeping conditions as well. Ron,Windsor,Ont., Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average facility...”
Reviews.Author: Fe
Reviews.Content: Location is good: near the main square with access to Accademia section of town. My single room was tiny and the bathroom was in disrepair: leaky sink, tiny shower with cracked tiles and worn, leaky doors. Others traveling with me said their rooms were in good condition and they were happy. The staff was friendly and the breakfast adequate. The barista made cappuccino to order-very nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel great staff”
Reviews.Author: tripvisor1234
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely, nice room. We had a triple. No bedbugs as someone else suggested. No bugs to speak of, but I did hear during the summer months that mosquitos were a problem in Venice and other parts of Italy as well. The staff couldn't have been nicer. The breakfast was good and they provided special coffees on request. Location was also great but in Venice all hotels are in good locations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great veiws but MOLD all over the bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: harris2285
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, in between san marco area and rialto, reasonably easy to find, however as Venice is so small, I now realise it doesn't really matter where you stay. The hotel room was quite large and below was the canal. The staff were ok. The main issue we had with our room was that there was mold all over the bathroom roof which gave the room a weird smell, my partner did not sleep because of the affect it had on his breathing. We asked for a different room, but were told that the hotel was full. I would not stay here again, and would not reccomend this hotel to anyone, however I absolutely LOVED venice!

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: mlively
Reviews.Content: The hotel Mercurio has a hotel section and also some neighbouring apartments. The apartment we stayed in was on the ground floor in the apartments next to the canal is excellent. It is a suite with Small kitchen/dining room, bedroom, bathroom and its own entrance. There are three very small balconies, just large enough to sit on. The air conditioner is silent and works well (A first for me even at very posh hotels :-p) It is located directly opposite the house that Mozart stayed at. The canal outside is one of the minor canals but is heavily used by the gondoliers as they like to point out the Mozart plaque. This adds a lot of charm to the Venice experience to hear the gondoliers sing on occasion or just watch them glide by silently. We stayed for three nights. During the stay I had a lost suitcase that took the entire 3 night stay to turn up. The staff were outstanding. They watched for changes in status in the lost baggage report on the internet, and made numerous phone calls to find out where my bag was and what time it would arrive. Without their help it is likely that we would have left for Rome in the end before it arrived, 5 hours after we were supposed to have left, as we were unable to speak to anybody helpful when we tried to phone ourselves. Their help is greatly appreciated and really saved our honeymoon from disaster. Thank you, Monica!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out if you pay with credit card.....you might be overcharged.”
Reviews.Author: luvintltravel
Reviews.Content: It's really a shame that we will remember our stay not by the room, cleanliness, location, etc., but by the scam we feel they pulled when we paid with a credit card. Although we confirmed verbally that the charge would be in Euros, that the USD amount shown was just to get an idea what the conversion would be, that our bank would make the final conversion, the charge slip we signed went thru in USD at their chosen rate plus an additional 2.75% fee. So be careful if you choose to pay by credit card. Read the fine print, be sure it says Euros only, don't rely on anything verbal. They have not even had the courtesy to respond to our several emails, much less correct the amount. As for the rooms, the canal view rooms are roomy, the classic rooms are tiny, but the place is clean.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, well run hotel in an excellent location - suite 53 was mega”
Reviews.Author: theseeds
Reviews.Content: When booking this hotel I used trip advisor for the first time to help make my choice. I was slightly concerned about a couple of negative reviews and also the fact that it was not in the top ranked hotels............... I am so glad that I ignored a couple of either unfortunate or plain grumpy people beccause this hotel did everyting it said on the tin. The location was awesome, a short walk from the Maco bus stop, when we arrived and around the corner from St Marks Squaer and the Rialto bridge. Thans someone from trip advisor for telling me about suite 53. My tip is spend a little more on this room and then instead of buying wine in an expensive bar, later in the evening, take it back and sip it on the balcony and enjoy the sights and sounds of a busy canal below. We could not tear ourselves away from this spot - beautiful. The staff were great - thanks to Monica especially who was very helpful and a real character. Would definitely go back .Breakfast could have been a little more exciting. The Seeds

Reviews.Title: “Very ordinary hotel - you can do better”
Reviews.Author: JudyJune2010
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the Hotel Mercurio was disappointing - it's not awful, it's just so ordinary and I think there are so many nicer options to stay for around the same money. From reading other reviews, it obviously depends a lot on the room you get - in our case the room had no canal view, was very basic, and had a terrible shower - little more than a dribble out of the spout. There was a hole in the wall, near where the air conditioner was installed - didn't affect anything, just looked very tacky. We had to pay for internet service. The service was functional but nothing special. The breakfast was very ordinary - one of the worst hotel breakfasts we had, even for Italy. The location is good but there are many other more charming hotels in the same vicinity. In a place like Venice, you want charm, and this wasn't it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but RUDE staff & BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: smjb78
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because a friend of a friend strongly recommended we stay here. Since we were planning to stay over the weekend, it was pretty expensive for a Suite that would accomodate 4 people--about 560 euros for two nights, which translated to approximately $700. We still decided to stay here after the recommendation and reading great reviews on this site. Also, it was in a good location, still touristy but not AS touristy as staying right near Piazza San Marco. Alot of the gondolas pass by on the small canal nearby, which can be nice to hear the guys sing. However, be prepared for the loud and obnoxious tourists who feel compelled to scream and shout while going down the canal. Gondola rides stop at 12 midnight, too! The last thing you want waking you up are overjoyed belligerent student travelers who feel liberated away from their parentals. ***Pros: 1) When it came time to check in, all of our luggage was in the very nice suite (apartment building next door, situated overlooking the canal). 2) Breakfast served in the morning included home made cappuccino, not from a vending machine. ***Cons: 1) Extremely rude elderly male staff member who works the nightshift. We had problems with our phone. We were dialing everything correctly, but there was still a busy dial tone. When arriving at the front desk, he told us we were doing it wrong and had us demonstrate with the phone in the lobby. Everything worked fine and we proved to have done things correctly. He then told us to go back to the room to use our phone because we couldn't use the one in the lobby. We explained to him that it was an urgent call and that our phone did not work in the room. He insisted that we were using it wrong!! Even after dialing everything correctly in the lobby!! This was a very urgent phone call, and there weren't any pay phones to be found. Very frustrating, especially if you're traveling from afar and communication with your loved ones back home is imperative! However, the male staff member working the dayshift was very friendly and so was the woman at check out. 2) My sister slept on one of the roll-away beds they use for quad rooms. The next morning she woke up with several bug bites on her arms and legs. We never left the window open and don't recall seeing any mosquitos in the room before we slept. 3) Left baggage near their front desk before check in. It is not in a secure place. Luckily nothing was stolen. I will not be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: mipesq
Reviews.Content: We only had 1.,5 days to spend in Venice so we picked Hotel Mercurio. It was an excellent choice, we had a wonderful stay. We were able to get the apartment next to the hotel, which had three tiny balconies overlooking the canal. I will attach pictures! The hotel was easy to find and reach via the vaporetto 1 from the train station. In addition, since we were only staying one night, they allowed us to leave our bags there after checkout. The breakfast was simple but good enough, the waitress made delicious cappucinos' and was willing to give you more than 1, unlike some hotels that give you attitude if you request more than 1 cup of cappucino. Furthermore, the apartment had a very comfortable large bed in comparison to other hotels. The bathroom was small but had everything one would need. In addition we took advantage of the 10 euro discount by paying in cash! Overall I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel. We will deifnitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again! Location is good but other than that everything is really bad!”
Reviews.Author: bhuchar
Reviews.Content: Lets begin with the good points about the hotel (because there is a much bigger list of bad ones!): 1. Excellent location - close to St. Marks square, and walkable from Rialto bridge. But Venice is a smallish place and I would rather stay somewhere else in Venice than pay so much just for this location. 2. Natale, the old, friendly, helpful man at the front office. Despite Natale, I would still rate overall customer service as bad. Negative points: 1. Bad Customer Service - Everybody else other than Natale was plain rude and sarcastic. The lady at the front-desk during the day just wasn't interested in helping anybody. Here are some examples - - The TV wasn't working throughout our stay and her response on day 2 was a simple, "I can't help you since I'm alone at the desk". - When we checked in, I asked if she had any room with a canal view and her response was "you'll see enough canals when you are outside in Venice, why do you need a canal view from the room"!!! - When asked if there was an elevator to go to the room, she said "there is only 1 flight of stairs", not mentioning that there were 23 steps to that single flight! - When I asked her whether Internet was free, she replied "nothing is free in Venice"... of course, sarcasm was free, it seems! - The lady managing the breakfast buffet was another rude lady, wagging her finger at us when we tried to help ourselves to a pot of hot water for tea. 2. Exorbitant charge for internet - EUR 3 or 4 per half hr! We got some limited time free because the TV wasn't working! Lucky us!!! 3. No elevator - the 1st flight of stairs had 16 steps to get to the reception, and then 23 steps to get to our room (if memory serves me right). 4. Small room - the room was small, the bathroom was even smaller. 5. The shower was the smallest I've ever seen. There was a stand to keep soap, but no shelves in the stand -- brilliant! Having said all this, a word of thanks again to Natale, the old man who was at the front desk in the evening shift. He even brewed us a pot of coffee at 4.30 am in the morning and helped us with luggage. May God bless him!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Peaches1975
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through trip advisor and can confirm it is everything we had hoped for. It is definitely a no frills hotel but it is clean and in a perfect location for St Mark's Square. We could easily walk to all the best known sites and the canal view from the superior double was well worth the extra money. Monica on the hotel reception was very friendly and provided us with any iinformation about cheapest places to eat and when to visit the sites. We could hear the gondolas from outside our window every morning and it was a charming spot. The rooms were basic and the bed a little hard but the bathroom was more than adequate. The only let down for us was the general expense of the trip, which had nothing to do with the hotel. We paid 23.50 euros for two small beers and two paninis so would recommend asking for the best spots from Monica before venturing out. Make sure you get to St Mark's Square at around 9am to queue for the Basilica!!!

Reviews.Title: “Venice's hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: kazzy63
Reviews.Content: Fabulous! We stayed in Suite 53 which is HUGE, spotlessly clean & a fabulous view of the canal. There are 4 windows in the room including 2 with small balconies where you can watch the gondolas go by (get ready for plenty of waving tho as everyone waves as they sail past!) 120 Euro's a night...What a bargain! I wouldn't stay anywhere else again! Easy to find if you print off the map from the hotels website. Staff recommended inexpensive restaurants for us which were lovely. Don't hesitate to book & I would 100% recommend you pay the little bit extra for suite 53, it will make your holiday that little bit more special!

Reviews.Title: “Suite 53 is fabulous! Best room which I stayed throughout the trip!”
Reviews.Author: chameleon20
Reviews.Content: The hotel map is clear/precise and we have no difficulty locating the hotel after leaving the ferry stop. It took us around 5 mins walk to the hotel. Upon reaching, their staff, Monica greeted us warmly and brought us to Suite 53 which I have booked from her 2 months in advance. This suite is really fabulous and huge! We were like "WOW' when we arrived and don't feel like stepping out of the room so soon. The view is great from the windows and the bed is soft and comfy. We can see gondolas passing by from the window every few minutes. Their staff, Monica was really nice and helpful when we check with her about the ferry to Burano and Murano for the next day. She was very patient and explained to us in clear details. Overall, really happy with my stay in Hotel Mercurio & I miss Suite 53 lots!

Reviews.Title: “Endearing”
Reviews.Author: Rogersmax1
Reviews.Content: Very Central location easy walk through to St Marks Square and Rialto. Difficult to find at first but if you book ,email the hotel the hotel which i didnt do and they will give a very simple map which is more direct than trying to find your way from a map of venice, these are extremely complicated to follow. We arrived in the early hours of the morning, which didnt help, would recomend an early flight if you havent been before. Just by the opera house and after a few very pleasant walks was easy to find. Staff very helpful and gave good advise on getting about the city. Reasonable rates rooms not huge but comfortable breakfast basic but adequate coffee was lovely. Must have coffee in st marks expensive but you just have to!!!. Put your shades on and pretend your rich. Venice was a fantastic expeiriance. Thank you Hotel Mercurio. Use the vaparatio water bus it so easy and is allways ontime. Top Marks Beautiful Place friendly People.

Reviews.Title: “Little perl of Venice”
Reviews.Author: NicolasLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: We suggest to all our fellow travellers not to be put off by two star rating of this hotel. This is true perl hidden right in the heart of Venice. Those lucky to get a spacious suite 53 with balcony, view to the canal and Motzart House will have unforgetable experience of romantic side of Venice. Staff are simply fantastic: very professional, friendly, helpful, efficient. Those who used to stay in luxurious hotels may find breakfest choices limited, but this is compensated by multiple cafes just few minutes walk offering true italian cappuchinos, pastries and sandviches. This hotel is simply unbeatable value for money. We will stay there again on our next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically located & staffed hotel......”
Reviews.Author: horseybreeze
Reviews.Content: just returned from a stay at the Hotel Mercurio in Venice. I was taking my 63 year old mother abroad for the first time ever so was crossing my fingers that the hotel would live up to what I was expecting! And it did. From Monica who was extremely helpful, both in making sure our stay was confortable to telling us the very best way to get round Venice on their very confusing public transport system(easy when you know how!). If you follow the map from the hotel website (luckily I've been before and didnt need it!), you will get to the hotel from San marco vaporetto stop with only 1 bridge to cross with your cases, and this is the one right outside the front door! We had a fantastically large room in the new part of the hotel, and had 2 balconys and another 2 windows to open and look down upon one of the main gondola canals. This was fantastic as I wanted to give my mother the whole Venice experience!!! So thank you Monica for making our stay a great one (I know you read this site!) I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definately choose it again, should I return to Venice. Sarah, room 53

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find but well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: slwjpw
Reviews.Content: We should have looked at Google Map before we left. When we finally located the Hotel Mercurio, the staff were gracious and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory accommodation”
Reviews.Author: MollieBristol
Reviews.Content: I reviewed the Hotel Mercurio before our trip to Venice and the reviews were very accurate. A small hotel, close to St Mark's Square in a lovely part of Venice. Clean, friendly staff and adequate breakfast. The rooms are small but adequate for the time you spend in them. Very helpful and friendly staff. I would certainly recommend this hotel and should I return to Venice I would stay at the Hotel Mercurio again. Remember, this is a two start hotel very close to the centre of Venice!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has it all”
Reviews.Author: Zosian
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mercurio is perfectly located in Venice. A few minutes' walk takes you to all the wonderful sights of Venice. Combine that with a very friendly and competent staff led by Monica (she's the best), a view from our room over the canal and the house Mozart stayed in over 200 years ago, and the delightful sounds of the gondoliers serenading their passengers and you have a great place to stay. Our thanks and congratulations to the this hotel; we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Met my needs”
Reviews.Author: Beth999
Reviews.Content: For a budget hotel the Hotel Mercurio was fine. Although I didn't get a canal view (sad) my twin room was clean and adequate with individual room A/C. We did need to go up a total of 57 stairs to get to our room - think of it as their fitness center. The breakfast, served in small room, was a typical continental breakfast. The hotel is a few minutes from St. Marks and the Rialto Bridge. Maria at the desk was very helpful. Keep in mind you are staying in a building over 500 years old.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: alicealmondgreen
Reviews.Content: Although the staff at this hotel were very friendly there was alot that we found disappointing. Our room was very small and although the cleaners who came in on a daily basis made sure that the ensuite, the floor etc were all cleaned, stuck to the wall (I guess where people had swatted them) there were a number of dead insects that remained there for the four days we stayed. The interior of the hotel, including the bedroom, was very scruffy and in need of refurbishment. The breakfast room was very small and people often had to wait for a table to be cleared. The breakfast itself was also poor and at times things such as the bread rolls were stale. The selection of food was fairly limited and once something was finished it was not replaced. Overall we felt that for what we paid, what we received was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Charming staff, wonderful canal view.”
Reviews.Author: NameAlreadyTaken75
Reviews.Content: Very satisfactory. The staff couldn't be more helpful. They let us leave our luggage in a safe place when we arrived early and after we checked out, helped carrying our bags up the stairs, provided good recommendations and maps -- nothing too much trouble. The room was simple but perfectly adequate and clean. The canal view was unforgettable. It's not just a view, but the experience of opening the shutters, leaning out the window, looking down not onto a street but onto a canal, and being almost within touching distance of the gondolas and boats passing by. The price was reasonable by Venetian standards -- room for three adults, breakfast included, $260 total. The hotel's not easy to find at first, the entry is an unprepossessing doorway in a narrow street, and there's a stairway up and no elevator. But I'd take it over a luxury tourist hotel any day.

Reviews.Title: “Should be 3 Stars instead of 2”
Reviews.Author: dsteele22
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome hotel. They are doing construction but we were able to stay in the new part and also had a canal view, as requested. We could not have had a better location. The woman at the front desk was so pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Offer of Canal View”
Reviews.Author: JustToWarnOthers
Reviews.Content: We paid for a "canal view" room at the Mercurio Hotel in Venice, but when we arrived we were told it wasn't available due to construction. We paid the same rate for a "roomier" (an amenity I didn't care about) room. I had extensively read reviews of hotels on San Marco. My experience was not uncommon! My advice is to not book a "canal view." Additionally, there was no shower pressure. Yes, we reported it after I took my shower using cups. I didn't want to waste any of my precious second day of 2 in Venice waiting for repairs. Apparently the filter had to be replaced, which was done when we returned before dinner. No concession in price was offered.

Reviews.Title: “A must..fantastic place to stay..you won't be disapointed.”
Reviews.Author: markCheltenham
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 nights at this fabulous hotel only minutes from St.Marks square, and once you get to know your way around, only a few more minutes from the Rialto bridge. We arrived at nearly midnight on the Friday and were met at reception by a fantastic chap who was only too happy to get us checked in and to our room.I cant remember how to pronounce his name, but he has a little go-tee beard.He will know who he is if he is reading, so thank you very much for a fantastic stay, and to all the other staff as well. Now to the point, the hotel is typical venetian, quaint, traditional, exactly what we went there for. The room we had wasn't large,(not a critisism at all) but functional, clean, comfy, changed daily..perfect. Very important for my wife was the power of the shower, and this had plenty. We were lucky to have a room with a little balcony which over looked the canal. Breakfast was continental, fresh pastries and geat coffee.Our flight on the day we left wasn't until the evening, so they held on to our cases until we left, and there was a bathroom on the second floor where we were able to change and freshen up before leaving to catch the boat to the airport. Another great point, when you leave the airport, catch the Alilaguna boat/taxi service to Venice, 13 euros each. It will drop you near to St.Marks square. From here, the walk to the hotel is only 5 minutes through the narrow lanes.We printed off the map as recommended by other travelers from the hotel website and found the hotel with ease. For the money we spent to stay at this great hotel, it far exceeded our expectations, although I knew it should have done from reading other travelers reviews. We will re-visit Venice agian sometime, and with out a doubt will return to the Mercurio. Before booking my trip I did plenty of research, and feel lucky to have found a gem like this. If I could save other travelers hours of trawling through the net looking for the perfect bolt hole in Venice then look no further. The staff were great, location fantastic, if you are going to Venice then stay here. Regards, Mark.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: TJItaly
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel. Great location, easy access to all attractions. Room was small but very comfortable. The best part of our stay was the help that Monica gave us, she showed us where to go to see the real Venezia, away from all the tourists, tried great restaraunts from her recommendations. Would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “bare bones third floor walk up”
Reviews.Author: wife-o-chris
Reviews.Content: We were pretty bummed out about this hotel, but the upside is that it was not that expensive and was right in San Marco. We surely could have done better for the same money, but maybe a coule of blocks further from the square. That doesn't really matter that much since you expect to be walking around all the time anyway. The showers in all of three rooms in our group were a joke, but again, we got through it, just not comfortably. The point is to get out and see Venice, we sure didn't want to spend a bunch of time in these micro-rooms. The place needed a good dusting, but the maids did a good job with the daily cleaning. The girl in the breakfast room was nice, but that too was cramped and didn't offer much of a selection, very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Central location - spoiled by external noise”
Reviews.Author: RossandSue
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on the bulk of recommendations on TripAdvisor. Location and service both very good. Front desk staff always very helpful. Room as predicted was pretty small as was the bathroom, shower too small for a 6 footer. But hey, this is central Venice, and you don't expect to spend a lot of time in your room anyway. Greatest disappointment was the amount of external noise at night. Our room was located above a very 'echoey' square, which conveyed every noise with alarming volume, from the restaurant below, to the seagulls above, to people walking past, to the bells every hour (midnight was the killer!). When visiting Venice, you need to remember that given how many churches there are, there's a good chance one of them will be near your hotel! I guess we were unlucky with the room we got, but it did mean we struggled to get a good night's sleep. It depends what you're expectations are and what noise you can put up with, but not sure we would recommend this hotel (unless you can guarantee a better room).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: skarleta01
Reviews.Content: Absolutley recomended. Great location. 5 minutes from San Marco, 10 min. from Ponte Rialto but not crowdy. Nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: EJG_04
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice and wanting to have excellent accommodatino without paying top dollar. Hotel Mercurio is in an excellent location, close to many tourist spots but off the beaten track so it is quiet and peaceful. The staff are friendly, welcoming and helpful. The rooms are tidy, the sheets clean, the bathrooms new. Your room is serviced daily with fresh towels. The breakfast is much nicer than some I have had in European hotels and is included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel near St marks and La fenice”
Reviews.Author: techmgr1
Reviews.Content: Excellent cozy small hotel with friendly helpful staff. Greta location Make sure you print out and take the map on their website as hotel is a little dificult to fiond without it.

Reviews.Title: “A really good location at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: StevefromBelfast
Reviews.Content: Venice is very expensive, particularly for a location this close to St Marks Square. Our room was quite basic, but it was clean and had a window overlooking the canal. Overall i felt this hotel represented good value.

Reviews.Title: “Best hot chocolate!!!”
Reviews.Author: Designahead
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in Venice there was extremely high tide. We didn't know that all the streets would be full of water - making it impossible to reach the hotel... I wish some one had warned us - we would've taken wellington boots... The water did go down after about an hour but just check out the tides - or pack boots before you go. The hotel was lovely. Big room, clean bathroom - very Venician. Monica - at the front desk - was very helpful & friendly. Breakfast was good - the hot chocolate was FANTASTIC! I would recommend this hotel for the good location, and for Venice the price is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shepsphoto
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel without much difficulty, but were glad we travelled light, with only one bag each (on casters0..there are three sets of steps to go over from the water taxi stop, to the hotel.The welcome was great, and I appreciated the help up the steps from the front desk manager! The room overlooked the canal, with a small balcony, and was simple, but clean, as was the bathroom. The location is ideal to walk to St Marks Square and most of the attractions , museums, shops etc. The breakfast was nice, with an excellent , fresh coffee to start the day. Although there was no mini bar , the front desk attendant was always willing to supply us with ice for cocktails.Wine was not a problem, as we simply left it on the balcony (12 degrees C) to chill. Monica was a gem, and was very helpful in showing us on a map, where to go etc. I was glad that we booked directly and did not prepay,as the Euro had dropped to 1.33 when we checked out. The Mercurio Hotel is not at all fancy, (quaint) would be a good description..but overall, a great little place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Captures the essence of Venice”
Reviews.Author: carabr
Reviews.Content: Staff is friendly and helpful. Location is perfect - a short walk from San Marco square, but off the beaten path enough to be a quiet retreat. It's near the Fenice theater and wonderful restaurants/shops. We had a small apartment overlooking the canal (right across from Mozart's former home!) and it was amazing to sit there and watch the gondole go by in the evening. The rooms are larger than most European hotels, and extremely clean. The style is purely Venitian with the dark wood ceiling rafters and brocaded comforters. Breakfast is included for all guests, with cereal, marmalata/cake, fruit, bread, and coffee/cappucino, juice and water served during our 3-day stay. If you're a high-maintenance American, beware that there is only one English-speaking TV station available (BBC News) and no A/C. If you are staying in the main hotel, you will have to climb/carry your luggage up the front staircase - there is no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Mercurio is a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: J_M_Ferreira
Reviews.Content: In the early days of August 2008, six of us (two couples with two kids aged 6) stayed at the Hotel Mercurio. For â‚¬ 100,00 room/night, breakfast included, we could not want more than what we got: fab location towards St Markus Square, large clean rooms with good WC and lots of hot running water. And the AC did really worked very well! So, if you want a room in Venice, in the middle of the summer, and do not want to pay too much, choose the Hotel Mercurio and you will not regret it. We beleive that a room in Venice is only for sleeping, as the city has too many beautiful monuments to stay inside the hotel. In conclusion: the Mercurio is a nice and basic hotel, within a walking distance to the main atractions and a very pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great price”
Reviews.Author: AussieBecs
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Hotel Mercurio in December 2007. I requested a canal view room and had one with a double bed, single bed and ensuite. Our windows overlooked the canal and were directly across from the plaque noting the Mozart had stayed in that plazzo (the one across the canal) during Carnivale. The best thing about this hotel is the location and price - we paid 100 Euros in cash per night and this was a great deal considering we are right around the corner from La Fenice and also San Marco square. It's a lovely quiet location and its amazing to have gondolas go past. At night it gets even quieter as day trippers go home and Venice virtually shuts down. As such, it means finding a meal and a drink somewhere can be suriprisingly challenging! The room itself was quite old and outdated and the hotel halls were poorly lit...but who cares when you're only paying 100 Euros for the best location on Venice?!

Reviews.Title: “Best part of our trip!”
Reviews.Author: swirlywirly
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend were travelling around Italy for 10 days, we stayed in 6 different locations, Hotel Mercurio was for sure my favourite place. Once arriving in venice jump on the number 1 vaporetto and get off at the first san marco stop (the vaporetto goes all the way down the grand canal and is a fab way to travel and see so much on your first moments in venice) it is a 5-10 minute walk from there, its not difficult to find at all if you have some sort of directions or map, there were 3 turns only before arriving at hotel mercurio. On arrival monica was great as other people have said and she informed us that we were going to be staying in one of there apartments over looking the canal not in the actual hotel, it was only two doors down from the hotel, were not sure what the reason behind this was but we were extremely happy with the very spacious apartment we were given as we had our own keys and didn't have any stairs to climb. so i would recommend asking about the apartments, not sure if they cost more as we charged for what we had booked. The hotel location is fab, just 5 minutes from san marco. theres is lots and lots of places to eat near the hotel, snack places and restaurants. you can get a huge slice of pizza for just two euros just down the street. There is also lots of shops (quite expensive designer ones) The best thing about the hotel is the constant stream of gondolas going past in the evening with singers and people playing music. The breakfast was slightly different the two days we were there but very nice and we always started our day with a full stomach. I would definatly stay here again, its a lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: tnworldtravel
Reviews.Content: Good location and great breakfast but a basic hotel. The location is within a 5 minute walk of St. Mark's square. You only have to cross one bridge from the San Marco vaporetto stop to get there, making it easy to get to with luggage. The breakfast is a great spread and the staff is very helpful. There is not a lift at the hotel at all. Air conditioning does not work well. The shower is a bit small. The location makes it worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great convenient stay at the Mercurio!”
Reviews.Author: fillerup98
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4-night stay at this hotel. We stayed in room #25 which had two windows that opened to the canal, with boats and gondolas strolling by quite frequently. We thoroughly enjoyed all the boats and signing each morning and evening! We had no trouble at all reaching the hotel - as long as you take the #1 vaparetto, you will be fine. Venice was the only city in Italy where we did not get lost making it to our hotel from the train station... strange, huh? Monica at the front desk was very helpful, kind and welcoming. So I echo what has already been said about her. Everything about our stay at this hotel was great, as we had our expectations about our room and the breakfast, etc. If you have any questions about this hotel, please let me know!

Reviews.Title: “Mercurio is great”
Reviews.Author: Quabba
Reviews.Content: I agree with what I have read in other reviews. The hotel was a bit hard to find at first, but that is par for the course in Venice. Its hard to find your way around until you get used to it. Staff was great especially Monica who helped me enormously with train tickets and hotel reservations for our next stop. They have a computer for guests to use for a nominal fee. Room was well located, close to St Mark's. Price was 140 euro a night for a double. We had the same room as the one in the picture titled "Our slightly messy room." It looked over the canal and we got to listen to the gondoliers sing as they went past. We also got to listen to a French couple screaming at eachother on the street at 2 in the morning because they were lost- so bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. I would also close the windows bc I got some brutal mosquito bites- and I am from Manitoba where mosquitoes are our provincial bird! Not a lot of mosquitoes but they gave me huge welts that lasted for at least 10 days. Breakfast was quite good, not as great as our hotel in Prague, but better than the one in Krakow. A great place.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TweakerStAlbans
Reviews.Content: We arrived in venise on the 21st April in the pouring rain, and then discovered we had to pull our cases to the hotel not knowing where to go. Eventually finding it, wet & exhausted we were greeted by an extremely cheerful Monica who sorted everything out for us.We found the staff very accommodating and helpful at all times.The hotel was very clean and the room a good size, as well as being beautifully situated and central. All in All our stay in Venise was really enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: cdsh
Reviews.Content: This was an absolutely perfect location for Venice being so close to St. Marks square. The value was great for Venice. The room was just as I expected- clean, small and had a small bath. It had shuttered windows that looked out onto a quiet street. We were on the top floor (3rd) and there is no lift. The breakfast was better than expected, actually I would consider it excellent. The ONLY DIFFICULTY that we had was not having adequate directions initially. Venice is very confusing and easy to get lost. We flew into the airport, bought a bus ticket to Piazza Roma and a water taxi ticket to S. Marco. It is actually very easy to find, just get adequate directions beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Budget”
Reviews.Author: pushn25
Reviews.Content: Great Small Hotel. Great Location. Very Helpful Staff. There are stairs so be ready to carry your bags! There was some construction going on outside, but that seemed to be the theme in all of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: rat22
Reviews.Content: good location, friendly staff (Monica), breakfast is excellent. I have had the best bread provided by this hotel in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tagster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights during the Carnival season Room rates were excellent and upon arrival we were upgraded to the apartment for no extra charge. Room is dated and a little tatty in places but is very clean and comfy. We flew into Marco Polo then got the land bus and then walked from the drop off. It is an easy walk and a good excuse to stop for some drink. San Marco square is signposted the whole way and the hotel is only 5 mins from here. Great location. Breakfast is good, with cereals, rolls, cakes, yoghurt, tea, coffee etc. Staff are excellent. Some of the friendlest I have met. All in all I would highly recommend a stay here

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: toto0713
Reviews.Content: We have this romantic gateaway in this marvelous city Venice. we enjoy the gondola ride and adventure the neaighboring island Burano , Murano and Terano which got superb history. We enjoy the vaporetto ride towards the hotel and vise versa. We have enjoy our stay in this wonderful magnificent place.

Reviews.Title: “Mercurio and Venice”
Reviews.Author: LeicesterMatt
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 nights at the Mercurio. I found the hotel pleasant and comfortable and would recommend it. It is not the Ritz but for the cost (Venice prices) it represented good value. The hotel was easy to find (get off at the San Marco stop on the Alilaguna ferry from the airport) and well positioned to explore Venice. We had a mixed bag of weather and got wet and cold one day, the hotel had a good heating system and plentiful hot water. The room we stayed in was small but ok, it was clean and the bathroom good. The shower was a tight fit but again ok (I am 6ft5in) The breakfast was nice if limited but the coffee was good. The staff were friendly and the night manager was very helpful and spoke good english. Venice itself was a delight but on the downside the food was variable and expensive. Had one fantastic meal at Albergo agli Alboretti, well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “good small hotel”
Reviews.Author: shonarakeri
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at Hotel Mercurio, though its greatest attribute is its location within a few blocks of San Marco Square and a short walk to Rialto. The rooms are cute but really small - you can touch the walls on three sides of the bed within 8 inches. That was fine for me, because I'm used to small European hotels, but for my in-laws, who are used to big American hotels, it was a bit of a shock. The rooms and bathrooms are spotless, though some showers are so small that you can hardly lift your arms. There are also steep stairs with no lift, so it's a bit more difficult for older people.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, great location!”
Reviews.Author: kj3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the heat of July with our 2 children, 12 & 15. It was a pleasant surprise for a 2 star hotel. The room had plenty of space for 4 people and 4 suitcases. It was clean and the air-conditioning kept it cool. I had read about noisy hotels so brought ear plugs but the room was quiet and we slept well. We did not have a view of the canal but we did not ask for one. (Perhaps that's why our room was quiet.) The staff speaks excellent English (as well as other languages) and were friendly and helpful, answering our questions about transportation, restaurants etc. It's a great location, close to Saint Mark's Square and the Realto Bridge. Breakfast was served in a small but cheery room and included the typical hard rolls, yogurt, canned fruit, cereal, and the welcome morning coffee. We took a bus from the airport and then vaporetto from Piazzale Roma. We used the hotel map as well as a city map to find the hotel. I walked right past it but, luckily, by husband spotted "Mercurio Hotel" on the open door. If you are using small bags on rollers, it's easy to maneuver through the narrow streets...just watch closely for the hotel door on the left. The hotel does not have an elevator which may be difficult for some people and is another reason to avoid huge suitcases. The hallways did not seem to be airconditioned but our room was always cool. It was a great hotel from which to explore an enchanting city. The only thing we would change is the exchange rate!

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel,small rooms, but central location for Venice”
Reviews.Author: MrB66
Reviews.Content: Central Location but rooms very small and not in good condition. However, staff in hotel were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: Jim1324
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in Venice, we set out on trying to find the hotel which became a task in itself. Generally it's kind of tough to find addresses to begin with and after about 2 hours of searching with our backpacks on we gave up and my Wife approached a police officer who was more than happy to point us in the proper direction. (Hint.. For addresses in Venice, you must know the quadrant you want to be in as there are duplicate addresses in each quadrant) Once we reached the hotel we were confronted with a huge staircase, we reached the top and met Monica the lady at the front desk. She was a huge help and extremely friendly. We had rented a canal view room and she stated that instead of giving us a room in the hotel, she offered us an apartment a few doors down from the hotel. We took it and were more then pleased. We had our own entrance that entered onto a courtyard. Off of the courtyard were several doors that led to private residences including our apartment. Inside the apartment we were pleasantly impressed, it was ground floor (meaning no huge amount of stairs) and about 8 feet above the canal itself. There was a small kitchen (no cooking appliances though) and a seperate bedroom. Off of the small balcony we had a beautiful view of a small canal and for curiousity sake was facing the former home of Mozart. The room also had it's own AC and fully stocked mini fridge which was refilled daily. Here is a list of the only downsides we could think of. 1. The shower was very small. Walk forward and park yourself. Don't drop the soap! 2. Sleeping-in is a little difficult, although we weren't bothered by it and thought it was kind of neat.. The canal the hotel is facing is on a major gondola route, so you will get a lot of singing and music late at night and fairly early in the morning. 3. The second day that we were there the water level in the canal was low and it became pretty smelly. Actually, it was smelly enough that we had to close the window to our room. This was allievated the 3rd day when it rained overnight (the smell completely disappeared) I would highly recommend this hotel and especially the seperate apartment. Another Hint for finding the place.. It's only about 7-10 minutes max away from San Marco's square. If you can find that, you know your close. PS. A great place to eat is the Al Teatro. Fantastic food. If they still have it, I suggest the Chef's Pizza, which looks more like a Calazone. Inside was baked Brie, and on-top was Rucola, Shaved Parmeasan all drizzled with olive oil. Fantastic. The resturant is also only a short walk from the hotel (2 mins)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: thechickensisters
Reviews.Content: Having used trip advisor many times thought it is about time for me to write own review to help others. Booked Hotel Mercurio on recommendation from another hotel we wished to stay in but booked but wasn't disappointed. We booked a canal view which is worth it as right on bridge/canal where all the gondolas pass (can get bit noisy at rush hour!) Rooms are clean decent size bathroom and air con Hotel is five minutes walk from St Marks Square (and aquiliana water bus stop from/to airport) staff extremely helpful, breakfast fits the bill even prepared some when had early departure Would recommend private transfer from airport though worth the extra (around 90 euros or 24 for bus) Visited Burrano pretty contrast to Venice Would definately recommend Hotel Mercurio to others and would use again

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Adventurer610
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mercurio is very well-located near Piazza San Marco. While the rooms are a little small, the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast is simple but plentiful, and the hotel is very comfortable. It's certainly worth the cost for the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but construction”
Reviews.Author: twokats2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for my 50th birthday. After spending hours on the internet searching for a hotel that had good ratings AND two rooms with a canal view, I booked the Mercurio. We arrived at the hotel (which wasn't too hard to find) to see that the entire front of the hotel was enclosed in scaffolding draping and wood - everything was under construction. Other than that, the room was nice, you could 'hear' the gondolas going by but not see them. The breakfast was decent. I was just very disappointed to find that our 'room with a view' had no view and there was no compensation offered for the fact that we paid extra for a view that we didn't receive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelCT
Reviews.Content: For two stars, this hotel provides excellent value. The location is great...close to San Marco square, the Rialto and plenty of restaurants and shops. We were given a room just off from the front desk. The room was small but this should be of no surprise. I would not recommend the rooms just off from the front desk as we encountered a fishy odor in the late afternoon which must have been coming from the resturant located in the piazza which the windor was overlooking. Luckily, we were given a new room because someone else, arriving the following day, actually requested the rooms near the front desk. Our next room was very large. It was ideal for a family of 3. A queen bed and a twin bed. All rooms were very clean. Breakfast was great. I can't say enough wonderful things about the staff. They are absolutely wonderful! Great value, great location and wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Ramonitje
Reviews.Content: It is important to keep all things in perspective. First, this is a "two star" rated hotel. Second, as a destination, Venice is inordinately expensive. Our double room rate of â‚¬ 160 per night including breakfast was very reasonable - given these facts. The staff, especially the lady behind the desk were super friendly, helpful to a fault and the entire experience was truly memorable. As a couple in our 50's were young enough to consider ourselves as "young" but old enough to have certain expectations. The cleaniless of all the facilities was impecable. Lots of towels, and by our standards an exceptionally comfortable (firm!) bed. The room and bath were both small but we were in Venice to experience this incredible city, not to hang out in the room. The only "beef" was the tiny stall shower - but this was a small price to pay for such a homey environment, where we felt like family. There's no question we'll be going back to Venice in the future and the Hotel Mercurio will definitely be our base of operations. We can and do recommend it enthusiastically.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CO92
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Mercurio for three nights. Although our canal view was blocked by scaffolding, we were told that we could move our room if that was not acceptable. The hotel staff, Monica and Natale, are extremely warm and friendly. Monica speaks several languages fluently and made us feel at home. The room was small but clean and internet is available for a reasonable price. The location is excellent. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, next to San Marco”
Reviews.Author: MeadowsValleyForge
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Mercurio and spent 140 euro a night which I think is inexpensive for its awesome location next to St. Mark's Square. Staff is extremely helpful and very attentive. Getting to the hotel was easy for first timers like me. However, the hotel's website instructs you to disembark at "Station 14, Calle Vallaresso", which is wrong or the very least a bit confusing. The street next to the station is named Vallaresso, but the water bus stop/station is "San Marco". My wife and I arrived very early in the morning on a Sunday, so the very tight streets of Venice are practically empty. This allows us to navigate without getting pushed by people following you. Breakfast was basic but very adequate. This includes your standard bread, croissants, cake, variety of spreads, cheese and butter, cereals, yogurt as well as fresh banana and apple, orange juice and very good cappuccino. We overslept on our 2nd day, but the lady was nice enough and accommodating to prepare a breakfast tray for two to take it to our room. Our room has two awesome views of the canal, one at the dining area and the other from the bedroom. However, this room is located "outside" of the hotel. The building where the hotel is located is still being renovated, so there are scaffoldings around it. Luckily our window is not completely covered and can still see the gondolas passing by. Construction noise starts promptly at 8 AM, so be prepared not to stay in bed all morning. Bathroom is small and shower stall is very tight. The window next to the shower has traces of mold and so does the shower curtain. On our last day the hotel maintenance staff came in our room unannounced to repair the water heater. Hotel sits across a historic building where Mozart stayed in Venice. Facility is also less than a 2 minute walk to La Fenice. The streets leading to San Marco are lined up with designer shops (Chanel, Louis Vuitton, Gucci, Bruno Mali, etc.) and it is so close to the hotel that we both ran back to our rooms to rest then head back down again. We like the location but may consider other hotel on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Mercurio”
Reviews.Author: WirralReddevil
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Venice having stayed at the Mercurio. This is a very well located hotel, quite literally a five minute walk to San Marco in one direction and Rialto in another. The hotel is spotlessly clean and very comfortable., We had a small twin room with ensuite (walk-in) shower room (newly fitted), and were next to reception and breakfast room. Ideal for those less mobile Breakfast choice good and plenty of tea, coffee etc. Drinks available at a small cost throughout the day. The air-conditioning is now on for the summer. The staff are exceptionally helpful and very friendly. Remember this is only a 2 star hotel, but we found the overall experience a really excellent one. At the moment there is still scaffolding outside, but don't let that put you off staying here. How long do you really want to stay in your room with all of Venice to explore?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: WiMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: This is great value for Venice. It is just 5 minute walk from St. Marks square. The staff is very nice, they recommended two very nice restaurants in Venice. The room is small and the bathroom is even smaller, but it is OK for Venice standards. Hotel has breakfast room and the breakfast was adequate. I would stay there again if I am in Venice. It was the least expensive hotel that was close to St. Marks square.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: traveller11111Usa
Reviews.Content: We arrived just to find out that they did not have a free room for us, even though we had booked it 2 months in advance. They set us up in a hotel right across the street, which ended up being WAY nicer and we wished we could stay there for the whole trip. Our double room was dirty, smelly, and loud...and it was so terrible we left a day early even though we had to pay for the extra night. We booked the hotel because it had a good rating on this website, which was clearly a lie! BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't tell me the single room only had a view of scaffolding!”
Reviews.Author: picklemuncher
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Venice by myself for a Wednesday through Friday in early November. I had read several reviews stating how great the place was, so I was very excited. I booked my room with them via email, and was impressed with their quick response time. When I asked if the single room had a canal view, they stated that single rooms have a view of a courtyard. Well, I thought that wouldn't be too bad, so I went ahead with the reservation. What they DIDN'T tell me was that the tiny "courtyard" was completely filled with scaffolding and that any view that I would have had through the scaffolding was covered by some sort of tarp. Couldn't see a darned thing!! I was VERY dissapointed. I just told myself that I wasn't in Venice to hang out in my room, but with the amount of walking that is inevitable there, you do end up spending some time in there. It kind of felt like tiny dark closed up box. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful (although I wish they would have told me the truth about the room before I reserved it). Also, at 8 am some sort of construction started on the rooftop. There was hammering and sawing ......luckily I hadn't planned on sleeping in. The breakfast the first morning (Thursday) had stale hard breadrolls...but Friday they were fine and they do have a good cappucino. Overall, at least it was clean, but I wouldn't stay there again. From what I've heard, they're fine for a double room, but clarify any view that they say you'll have.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: sea6t
Reviews.Content: I priced rooms all over the city of Venice and was a bit skeptical when I found the Hotel Mercurio offering rooms for 50 Euros per night. However, I read the reviews of the hotel and most travellers seemed pleased. I booked the hotel via email inquiry directly to the hotel. They responded very quicky. Once we arrived in Venice, the hotel was easy to find, and centrally located near the Piazza San Marco and the Rialto bridge. Literally a 5 minute stroll would get you to either place. Our room was not big, but quite comfortable with two single beds. Monica was the front desk clerk when we arrived. Since we were a bit early, she let us store our luggage until our room was ready, and she was extremely helpful with suggestions on where to go in Venice and how to get around. Natali was there in the evenings and early morning and was also very helpful. When we had to leave on our last day to catch an early flight, we left before breakfast was scheduled. He prepared our breakfast early just so we could eat before we left, and it was delicious! Coffee, fruit, bread and cheese, cereal, and croissants were all available. While not a four star hotel, it was very clean, comfortable and pleasant. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “nice location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Gilanah
Reviews.Content: Our room was so small that we had to coordinate movements, but it had a similarly tiny balcony over a canal, which was fun. The front desk staff wasn't helpful (couldn't operate the Trenitalia website after offering to help reserve a train, gave inaccurate directions to the laundry). Internet access is expensive; they charge by the hour, and it only worked in the hallway. Breakfast was great; fruit, yogurt, fresh bread, and cereal. The cappachino was good, and I could get a whole pot of coffee with a pot of hot milk. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in a great location”
Reviews.Author: leflerpet
Reviews.Content: Great location!!! It is midway between the Rialto and St. Mark's. There are many good restaurants in the neighborhood and the staff is more than happy to make recommendations and help in any way they can.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Vaillant
Reviews.Content: We have just returned on the 20th October 2006 after spending 4 days in Venice and had a wonderful time. We stayed at the Hotel Mercurio which we found excellent. The hotel was within easy walking distance to Saint Marks square and the Rialto Bridge with many good restaurants and bars close by.
