The hotel was clean and served a good breakfast and all the staff were extremely pleasant especially Monica who helped us plan trips, and gave us information regarding where to eat and even revived us with an uplifting cup of tea after a long tiring day. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Ceriselynne
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via a booking website, and a detailed address was not provided.I walked a long way with my luggage trying to find the hotel.That was really painful. (and the hotel itself doesn't have a lift). Actually the location is very nice and convenient, just be sure you carry the direction map with you upon arrival. The canal view is very charming, decent breakfirst, clean and well-maintained bathroom,and the lady at the reception desk is very friendly and helpful. Downsides are: the closet door can't be tightly closed, and the bed might makes some noises. Moreover, you can't have your privacy and sunlight and the same time--you have to close the whole wooden windows for privacy, which means no sunlight then . However, still Love Hotel Mercurio and feel such a pity to stay there for just 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: mrgnk
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well located, 5 minutes from San Marco Piazza and right next to Theatre Fenice. We spent 2 nights in a big room, a triple really, with 2 windows overlooking a canal, and one night in a tiny room, a double this time, but with a balcomy out over the canal. Standing in the balcony or at the window looking at all the gondolas glide past in the evening was great. The place was clean, the staff helpfull and the breakfast good. All in all, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: myTXchica
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many hotels all over Europe so I'm used to small rooms and what can be unfriendly staff. This hotel had neither. The room was spacious (going by european standards) and all the staff were friendly and extremely helpful. Our room overlooked one of the canals and we had gondolas constantly going by, some with the gondoliere singing. Very romantic. We had a 2 year old with us and they even offered to bring breakfast to our room so we didn't have to sit in their somewhat small and therefore crowded breakfast area. The location is excellent, 5 minute walk to San Marcos Square. Room was air conditioned which I've found a rare thing over here which was a HUGE plus. Room was nicely decorated with a pretty large double bed with good pillows, not those that immediately go flat as soon as you lay your head down. Scam Warning - don't buy colored stretchy balls from guy on the street. He, apparently, has one that is the real deal that he uses to show you how you can form them into different shapes. What he sells you is a balloon filled with flour.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: sumguy
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 nights in June in a triple room at the hotel and we enjoyed it soo much. Room was very spacious and clean. It is an old building but well maintained. AC works good. Reception staff are so welcoming and helpful. I read that somewhere and I post it again "Monice is great". She is a very smart nice helpful lady. When you ask her about something, she will adopt the issue and help you with as much knowledge she has, and she knows alot. Other staff members were nice too. They carried our luggage all the way up and down as there was no elevator. we had to leave earlier than breakfast time last day and the receptionist kindly arranged a quick bite for us with coffee at 6 am. If I were to stay again in Venice, I will definitely consider this place.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel Mercurio in Venice is in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bnutting
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mercurio is in an excellent location only five minutes from St Marks Square and just around the corner from the Fenice Theatre. A short walk from the vaporetto makes this an ideal spot when you arrive with suitcases from the airport. Good value for money, clean, plentiful breakfast and welcoming knowledgeable staff. The room was a little on the small size and the shower was only for small people ( other rooms may vary) furniture a bit tired. We thought it was a real find. Such a reasonable price for a prime location. Will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location right near San Marco. Hotel was very easy to find. We had 3 rooms one on the canal and the others over looking a court yard, very beautiful. Staff was helpful and friendly and the breakfast was very good. Rooms were clean, my husband and I had an upstairs room the bathroom was very, very small but neat and clean. The other rooms that our parents had were bigger with bigger bathrooms. We all enjoyed our stay. I would get a canal room, very beautiful and peaceful. Fun to over look the canal and the door opens right over the canal. Very quite at night. Easy to walk to everything. This was my third time to Venice and by far this is the best hotel that I have found. I would definitely stay here again! Highly recommend and great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: dc4awhile
Reviews.Content: For the value this hotel cannot be beat. We stayed on the third floor when we first arrived in Italy and the rooms and shower (height) were a little small but adequate. We stayed on the second floor the night before we left Italy and the rooms and bathroom were larger but about 20 Euros more (friends thought it was worth the extra money for the larger room). The location is also great, just a short walk from the San Marco waterstop for both the Grand Canal and Airport by water bus. The area is also very nice - away from the crowds and madness around San Marco. The staff is friendly and provided excellent information on the water bus schedules.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rmarten
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mercuiro for 5 nights in November 2005. The hotel is on a very tiny street within a 5 minute walk of St. Mark Square. The staff is very friendly and helpful in all situations. The rooms are tiny but typical for a ** hotel in Venice. Breakfast is good with freshly made coffee service. The hotel has no elevator and all of the luggage must be carried up 1-3 floors depending on where your room is located.

Reviews.Title: “Needs cosmetic work”
Reviews.Author: gsmiles
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located in the San Marco area, an easy five-minute walk to St. Marks' Square. Its most appealing feature is that the canal side rooms are above a side canal that is used by many of the gondoliers. You can watch the tourists float by, but even better, you can listen to the fabulous voices and music as the gondolas pass by. I stayed here in June of 2002, and thought it deserved a three-star rating and was a bargain. Three years later, I was disappointed that they have not done basic cosmetic work - the room needed a new coat of paint badly, and there was mildew in the bathroom. Given the great location, the management should give more attention to such inexpensive improvements as paint and mildew treatment. The management has always been accommodating and friendly. The breakfast is your basic Italian breakfast. If I ever get to Venice again, I would probably look for other accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, would return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location close to Piazza San Marco, makes walking all around Venice easy. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is better than usual. Room is clean. Hotel is a little difficult to find, even with a map but staff is helpful by phone with directions. My single room was very small but that is to be expected in Italy. Rate was very good considering prices in Venice and the location. I will return to this hotel and recommend it to friends.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Mercurio
HotelInfo.Address: Calle del Fruttariol | San Marco 1848, 30124 Venice, Italy
